title.narrative: WAF: regional women's rights and farmers

description.narrative: Oxfam West Africa Regional Platform will use this contribution to help the work of two partners: WILDAF and ROPPA. WILDAF is a pan African NGO meaning Women in Law and Development in Africa. This partner will use the contribution for the following activities: # Monitor the gender mainstreaming in the implementation of ECOWAS policies, programs, plans and budgets to ensure implementation. # Advocate for policy and legal reforms on gender and women#s rights, as well as changes in practices, which are harmful to women. # Bring campaigning support and expertise to regional campaigns on women#s land rights, women#s smallholder farmer#s rights and violence against women. ROPPA is an initiative from farmers# organizations and agricultural producers across West Africa. This contribution will be used to organize its 7th convention for its 117 members. The main objective of the convention is to adopt measures, tools andcreate the necessary conditions, in accordance with the statutes of the network, to allow ROPPA to pursue effectively his action ofpromotion and defence of the family farms. One of the ways to do this is to inform and sensitize members of the network on key strategic issues and current challenges facing family farming through sharing of experiences and collective learning around a number of major critical issues for farms family.

participating-org.narrative:
Oxfam is working in Senegal since 1981 and has opened a first office in Senegal in 1983. Oxfam in Senegal is implementing a 5-year country strategy (2015-2019) which is articulated around the following vision which is:
Senegal has an active citizenry,comprising of a good representation of men, women and youth, that is willing and capable of influencing the development and implementation of national policies, and receives a more equitable share of the national wealth.
The country strategy uses a two-tiered approach: - to promote citizen participation in policy formulation and implementation processes; - To promote innovativefield programming that addresses the immediate needs of the poorest segments of society while strengthening their capacity to influence local authorities.
This strategy focusses on sustainable livelihoods, promoting good governance and humanitarian (contributingto strengthening the leadership of local actors in the context of integrated disaster management, from prevention to emergency response). It also recognizes the under-utilized potentialities and power of some marginalized groups, especially women and youth.
Oxfam in Senegal adheres to six partnership principles: shared vision and values,mutual accountability, complementarity, clarity of roles, institutional autonomy, and commitment to joint learning, and is carrying out projects through partnering with local NGOs and organisations (such as producer#s organisations).

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
